question_paper.question_paper_name: IIT M QUIZ 1 FOUNDATION DIPLOMA QPC2 16 Oct 2022

questions.question_text_1: For the following sentence, choose whether the type of sentence is simple, compound or complex:   He did not attend the reception, nor did he send any of his family members to the occasion.
question_texts: For the following sentence, choose whether the type of sentence is simple, compound or complex:   He did not attend the reception, nor did he send any of his family members to the occasion.

questions.question_text_1: For the following sentence, choose whether the type of sentence is simple, compound or complex:   The boy entered the room
question_texts: For the following sentence, choose whether the type of sentence is simple, compound or complex:   The boy entered the room

questions.question_text_1: How many dependent clauses are there in the following sentence:   The student missed the lecture
question_texts: How many dependent clauses are there in the following sentence:   The student missed the lecture

questions.question_text_1: In the following sentence, identify the complement(s) of the verb(s) that are underlined.   Kennedy builds an enormous home that juts out into the sea.
question_texts: In the following sentence, identify the complement(s) of the verb(s) that are underlined.   Kennedy builds an enormous home that juts out into the sea.

questions.question_text_1: ‘Hina walked the dog in the park.’ Here, the adjunct is _____.
question_texts: ‘Hina walked the dog in the park.’ Here, the adjunct is _____.

questions.question_text_1: Sarika, who won the filmfare award, will be our chief guest. Here the adjectival clause is
question_texts: Sarika, who won the filmfare award, will be our chief guest. Here the adjectival clause is

options.option_text: Sarika, who won the filmfare award
Both Sarika, who won the filmfare award and Who won the filmfare award

questions.question_text_1: I am looking for an employee who is well versed in corporate finance. Here the relative pronoun is ____.
question_texts: I am looking for an employee who is well versed in corporate finance. Here the relative pronoun is ____.

questions.question_text_1: ‘Haresh and Kabir vied for attention but neither of them received it.’ is a simple sentence.
question_texts: ‘Haresh and Kabir vied for attention but neither of them received it.’ is a simple sentence.

questions.question_text_1: Identify the independent clause in the following sentence.   This road leads to the next town, which is famous for its furniture.
question_texts: Identify the independent clause in the following sentence.   This road leads to the next town, which is famous for its furniture.

options.option_text: This road leads to the next town
Which is famous for its furniture

questions.question_text_1: Mary and I ___ going to the opera.
question_texts: Mary and I ___ going to the opera.

questions.question_text_1: Statement 1: The verb ‘go’ is transitive. Statement 2: The verb ‘go’ almost always requires an adverb/adjunct.
question_texts: Statement 1: The verb ‘go’ is transitive. Statement 2: The verb ‘go’ almost always requires an adverb/adjunct.

question_texts: Identify the adverb in the following sentence.  My cat is not sleeping.

question_texts: Adding ‘-able’ to ‘drink’ changes it from ______.

question_texts: Joyless is an adjective formed by adding a ______.

questions.question_text_1: Choose an option that fits well for the following situation.  Inquiring about the availability of team for scheduling a meeting
question_texts: Choose an option that fits well for the following situation.  Inquiring about the availability of team for scheduling a meeting

options.option_text: Please let me know if you are available at 6 PM.
Could you please come at 6 PM?
Will you be available at 6 PM?

questions.question_text_1: ‘Let us do the meeting in the conference room on the fourth floor‘. A softened version of this sentence is ____________
question_texts: ‘Let us do the meeting in the conference room on the fourth floor‘. A softened version of this sentence is ____________

options.option_text: Can we do the meeting in the fourth floor conference room?
Could we conduct the meeting in the conference room on the fourth floor ,please?
I was wondering if we could do the meeting in the fourth floor conferenceroom.

questions.question_text_1: Complete the following conversation using appropriate options in the given subquestions.  Harry: Hello. Is this XYZ Associates?  Mary: Hello. Yes, I am Mary here (1)____  Harry: (2) ____connect me to Mr. Joseph?  Mary: Sure. (3)_____  Harry: Thanks!  Mary: Mr. Joseph is not available. (4) ___ like to leave a message?  Harry: Yes. Please inform him to call me back.  Mary: Sure Sir.  Harry: (5)____

Please inform him to call me back.  Mary: Sure Sir.  Harry: (5)____
